quiz.text: Which of the following is not correct regarding Gender Equality?
options: Gender equality refers to the equal rights, responsibilities and opportunities of women and men and girls and boys.
Gender equality implies that the interests, needs and priorities of both, women and men are taken into consideration, recognizing the diversity of different groups women and men
Gender equality is both, a human rights principle and a precondition for sustainable, people-centered development
All are correct
None of the  above is correct

quiz.text: As a part of which of the following reports, is Gender Inequality Index (GII) brought out?
options: Ease of Living Report
Human Capital Report
Human Development Report
Global Assessment Report
None of the options given above

quiz.text: The GII (Gender Inequality Index) is an inequality index. It measures gender inequalities in different important aspects. Which of the following aspects is not part of Gender inequality index?
options: Reproductive Health
Empowerment
Economic Status
Social Status
None of the above

quiz.text: Company D Ltd. gives more salary to its male employees in comparison to female employees. Which of the following form of gender inequality is present in the aforesaid organization?
options: Ideological
Economic
Legal
Emotional
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following is the correct difference between female foeticide and female infanticide?
options: Female infanticide is the practice of killing a foetus after determining the sex of the foetus through an ultrasound test, while, female foeticide is the intentional killing of infant girls within one year of their births.

Female foeticide is the practice of killing a foetus after determining the sex of the foetus through an ultrasound test, while, female infanticide is the intentional killing of infant girls within one year of their births.

Female foeticide is the practice of killing a foetus after determining the sex of the foetus through an ultrasound test, while, female infanticide is the unintentional killing of infant girls within 5 years of their births.
While female foeticide is banned, there exists no policy measure to tackle female infanticide.
None of the options given above

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are incorrect with respect to Sex ratio of India?
options: Overall Sex ratio at the National level has declined by 10 points since Census 2001 to reach 933 at Census 2011.
Sex ratio as per Census 2011 is the highest Sex Ratio recorded since Census 1971 and a shade lower than 1961
Increase in Sex Ratio is observed in 29 States/Uts in census 2011
Three major States - J&K, Bihar & Gujarat have shown decline in Sex Ratio in census 2011 as compared to Census 2001
None of the options given above

quiz.text:
Which of the following can be harmful effects of gender inequality? 

1. Loss of talent 

2. Low confidence among people of other gender 

3. Sadness and stress among people of other gender
options: 1 & 2
2 & 3
1 & 3
All of the above
None of the  above

quiz.text: The Human Development Report (HDR) is an annual milestone published by the Human Development Report Office of the ______________
options: World Economic Forum (WEF)
United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
World Bank
United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)
None of the  above

quiz.text: Which of the following states/UTs have the lowest sex ratio as per Census 2011?
options: Dadra & Nagar Havelli
Daman & Diu
Haryana
Sikkim
None of the options given above

quiz.text: Which of the following day has been declared as International day to prevent violence against women?
options: 14th October
25th November
21st December
15th January
08th September

quiz.text: Gender budgeting means
options: Financial provision of more gender equal society
Financial provision of more gender unequal society
Financial provision to achieve human development
Financial provision for equality of every citizen
None of the options given above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct with respect to the Child Sex ratio in India? 

1. In India, the Child Sex Ratio is defined as the number of females per thousand males in the age group 0–6 years in a human population. 

2. The Child Sex Ratio at the India level (919) as per Census 2011 is the highest since Independence. 

3. While the overall Sex Ratio has shown improvement since 1991, the decline in Child Sex Ratio (0-6) has been unabated since the 1961 census 

4. 18 States / UTs out of 36 have registered a decline in Child Sex Ratio (CSR) during 2011
options: 1,2 and 3
1,3 and 4
1,2 and 4
1,2,3 and 4
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following represents the correct combination of states with highest and lowest child sex ratio as per census 2011 respectively?
options: Mizoram and Haryana
Meghalya and Punjab
Meghalya and Haryana
Mizoram and Bihar
None of the options given above

quiz.text: Which of the following Act fixes the legal age for marriage is 18 for women, 21 for men?
options: Prohibition of Child Marriage Act (PCMA) of 2006
Indian Penal Code (IPC) of 1860
Pre-Conception and Pre-Natal Diagnostic Techniques (PCPNDT) Act, 1994
Maternity Benefit Act, 1961
None of the options given above

quiz.text: Which of the following reasons is/are responsible for lower participation of women in labour workforce?
options: Women are generally reluctant to work as labourers
A woman’s work in her own household is not counted as an economic activity, and does not get reported in the national income statistics.
Women are not efficient labourers and hence overall their employment remains low
Women have other important family commitments  so they dislike labour force participation
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are correct about gender budgeting? 

1. It is a tool for gender mainstreaming. 

2. Gender budgeting uses the budget as an entry point to apply a gender lens to the entire policy process. 

3. Gender budgeting also recognizes that if gender disparities are to be addressed, adequate monetary allocations are to be made for the achievement of desired outcomes
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1,2 and 3 only
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is the correct formula for calculation of Worker Population Ratio?
options: (No. of unemployed person/Total Population) * 1000
(No. of employed and unemployed person/Total Population) * 1000
(No. of employed person/Total Population) * 1000
(No. of employed person/Total Population) * 100
None of the options given above

quiz.text: The Global Gender Gap Index is published by
options: UN Women
United Nations Development Programme
World Bank
World Economic Forum
International Monetary Fund

quiz.text: Which of these statements is true regarding 'gender'?
options: It is a numerical concept
It is biologically determined
It is the same as the sex of the person
It is a social construct
It is a physical construct

quiz.text: Task Force set up to examine matters pertaining to the age of motherhood, imperatives of lowering MMR, improvement of nutritional levels, and related issues was headed by which person?
options: Jaya Jaitly
Usha Thorat
Smriti Irani
Maneka Gandhi
Harsimrat Kaur Badal

quiz.text: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act has been passed in which of the following year?
options: 2003
2002
2005
2004
2006

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements with respect to The Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013:
  1. The Act defines sexual harassment at the workplace and creates a mechanism for the redressal of complaints.
  2. Every employer is required to constitute an Internal Complaints Committee at each office or branch with 20 or more employees.
  3. The Complaints Committees have the powers of criminal courts for gathering evidence.
Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 2 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Famous Vishakha Guidelines is related to which of the following?
options: Prevention of Child Marriage
Prevention of crime against Transgenders
Imparting education to poor children
Prevention of sexual harassment of women at the workplace
None of the above

quiz.text: Gender Parity Index is released by which of the following agency?
options: World Economic Forum
United Nations
International Monetary Fund
UNESCO
None of the above

quiz.text: SDG Gender Index has been developed by which of the following?
options: UNESCO
World Economic Forum
ILO
Equal Measures 2030
United Nations
